p: Parasitism may be a limiting factor for establishment of lepidopteran species in new areas. Native parasitoids have reduced the efficacy of some biocontrol agents, such as Neogalea sunia and S. haemorrhoidalis in the control of Lantana camara ( Hill and Hulley 1995; Baars and Neser 1999). Nevertheless, although S. lotanalis has been parasitized by several species, this caterpillar maintains its high density in the field, causing severe damage to M. calvescens. Moreover, no parasitism was verified in D. inscita, C. cardinata, or P. rudimentaria.
